chapter.title: Compute command-line client
chapter.para: The nova client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the OpenStack Compute API and its extensions. This chapter documents nova version 2.17.0.
For help on a specific nova command, enter:

listitem.para: Print a list of absolute limits for a user
Add new IP address on a network to server.
Add a Security Group to a server.
Add the host to the specified aggregate.
Create a new aggregate with the specified details.
Show details of the specified aggregate.
Print a list of all aggregates.
Remove the specified host from the specified aggregate.
Update the metadata associated with the aggregate.
Update the aggregate's name and optionally availability zone.
Backup a server by creating a 'backup' type snapshot.
Update the VPN IP/port of a cloudpipe instance.
Create a cloudpipe instance for the given project.
Print a list of all cloudpipe instances.
Get console log output of a server.
Show user credentials returned from auth.
Immediately shut down and delete specified server(s).
Create a DNS entry for domain, name and ip.
Print a list of available dns domains.
List current DNS entries for domain and ip or domain and name.
Discover endpoints that get returned from the authenticate services.
Evacuate server from failed host to specified one.
Retrieve info on a fixed ip.
Add flavor access for the given tenant.
Print access information about the given flavor.
Remove flavor access for the given tenant.
Set or unset extra_spec for a flavor.
Print a list of available 'flavors' (sizes of servers).
Show details about the given flavor.
Associate a floating IP address to a server.
Bulk create floating ips by range.
Bulk delete floating ips by range.
Allocate a floating IP for the current tenant.
Disassociate a floating IP address from a server.
List floating ips for this tenant.
Get a rdp console to a server.
Get a spice console to a server.
Get a vnc console to a server.
Perform a power action on a host.
List servers belonging to specific hypervisors.
Display the details of the specified hypervisor.
Get hypervisor statistics over all compute nodes.
Display the uptime of the specified hypervisor.
Create a new image by taking a snapshot of a running server.
Print a list of available images to boot from.
Set or Delete metadata on an image.
Show details about the given image.
Attach a network interface to a server.
Detach a network interface from a server.
List interfaces attached to a server.
Create a new key pair for use with servers.
Delete keypair given by its name.
Print a list of keypairs for a user
Show details about the given keypair.
List Security Group(s) of a server.
Migrate running server to a new machine.
Set or Delete metadata on a server.
Migrate a server. The new host will be selected by the scheduler.
Disassociate host and/or project from the given network.
Print a list of available networks.
Show details about the given network.
List the quotas for a quota class.
Update the quotas for a quota class.
List the default quotas for a tenant.
Delete quota for a tenant/user so their quota will Revert back to default.
List the quotas for a tenant/user.
Update the quotas for a tenant/user.
Print a list of rate limits for a user
Shutdown, re-image, and re-boot a server.
Remove an IP address from a server.
Remove a Security Group from a server.
Reset the state of a server.
Revert a previous resize (and return to the previous VM).
Change the root password for a server.
Delete data associated with the project.
Add a source group rule to a security group.
Add a rule to a security group.
Delete a source group rule from a security group.
Delete a rule from a security group.
List security groups for the current tenant.
List rules for a security group.
Show a list of all running services. Filter by host & binary.
Remove a shelved server from the compute node.
Show details about the given server.
Show usage data for a single tenant.
List usage data for all tenants.
Attach a volume to a server.
Detach a volume from a server.
Print a list of available 'volume types'.
Create x509 cert for a user in tenant.
Prints all of the commands and options to stdout so that the nova.bash_completion script doesn't have to hard code them.
Display help about this program or one of its subcommands.
Add a network interface to a baremetal node.
List network interfaces associated with a baremetal node.
Remove a network interface from a baremetal node.
Remove a baremetal node and any associated interfaces.
Print list of available baremetal nodes.
Show information about a baremetal node.
Evacuate all instances from failed host to specified one.
Migrate all instances of the specified host to other available hosts.
Get cell capacities for all cells or a given cell.
Show details of a given cell.
Set or Delete metadata on all instances of a host.
List all the os-api extensions that are available.
show program's version number and exit
Use the auth token cache. Defaults to False if env[OS_CACHE] is not set.
Defaults to compute for most actions
Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to env[OS_CACERT]
Explicitly allow novaclient to perform "insecure" SSL (https) requests. The server's certificate will not be verified against any certificate authorities. This option should be used with caution.
Use this API endpoint instead of the Service Catalog

section.title: nova absolute-limits command
section.para: Print a list of absolute limits for a user

listitem.para: Display information from single tenant (Admin only).

section.title: nova add-fixed-ip command
section.para: Add new IP address on a network to server.

section.title: nova add-secgroup command
section.para: Add a Security Group to a server.

section.title: nova agent-create command
section.para: Create new agent build.

section.title: nova agent-delete command
section.para: Delete existing agent build.

section.title: nova agent-list command
section.para: List all builds.

section.title: nova agent-modify command
section.para: Modify existing agent build.

section.title: nova aggregate-add-host command
section.para: Add the host to the specified aggregate.

listitem.para: The host to add to the aggregate.

section.title: nova aggregate-create command
section.para: Create a new aggregate with the specified details.

listitem.para: The availability zone of the aggregate (optional).

section.title: nova aggregate-delete command
section.para: Delete the aggregate.

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate to delete.

section.title: nova aggregate-details command
section.para: Show details of the specified aggregate.

section.title: nova aggregate-list command
section.para: Print a list of all aggregates.

section.title: nova aggregate-remove-host command
section.para: Remove the specified host from the specified aggregate.

listitem.para: The host to remove from the aggregate.

section.title: nova aggregate-set-metadata command
section.para: Update the metadata associated with the aggregate.

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate to update.

section.title: nova aggregate-update command
section.para: Update the aggregate's name and optionally availability zone.

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate to update.
The availability zone of the aggregate.

section.title: nova availability-zone-list command
section.para: List all the availability zones.

section.title: nova backup command
section.para: Backup a server by creating a 'backup' type snapshot.

listitem.para: Int parameter representing how many backups to keep around.

section.title: nova baremetal-interface-add command
section.para: Add a network interface to a baremetal node.

section.title: nova baremetal-interface-list command
section.para: List network interfaces associated with a baremetal node.

section.title: nova baremetal-interface-remove command
section.para: Remove a network interface from a baremetal node.

section.title: nova baremetal-node-create command
section.para: Create a baremetal node.

listitem.para: Name of nova compute host which will control this baremetal node
Number of CPUs in the node
Megabytes of RAM in the node
Gigabytes of local storage in the node
MAC address to provision the node
Power management IP for the node
Username for the node's power management
Password for the node's power management

section.title: nova baremetal-node-delete command
section.para: Remove a baremetal node and any associated interfaces.

listitem.para: ID of the node to delete.

section.title: nova baremetal-node-list command
section.para: Print list of available baremetal nodes.

section.title: nova baremetal-node-show command
section.para: Show information about a baremetal node.

section.title: nova boot command
section.para: Boot a new server.

listitem.para: Name or ID of flavor (see 'nova flavor-list').
Name or ID of image (see 'nova image-list').
Snapshot ID to boot from (will create a volume).
boot multiple servers at a time (limited by quota).
Record arbitrary key/value metadata to /meta.js on the new server. Can be specified multiple times.
Store arbitrary files from <src-path> locally to <dst- path> on the new server. You may store up to 5 files.
Key name of keypair that should be created earlier with the command keypair-add
user data file to pass to be exposed by the metadata server.
The availability zone for server placement.
Comma separated list of security group names.
Block device mapping in the format <dev- name>=<id>:<type>:<size(GB)>:<delete-on-terminate>.

key1=value1[,key2=value2...] Block device mapping with the keys: id=image_id, snapshot_id or volume_id, source=source type (image, snapshot, volume or blank), dest=destination type of the block device (volume or local), bus=device's bus, device=name of the device (e.g. vda, xda, ...), size=size of the block device in GB, format=device will be formatted (e.g. swap, ext3, ntfs, ...), bootindex=integer used for ordering the boot disks, type=device type (e.g. disk, cdrom, ...) and shutdown=shutdown behaviour (either preserve or remove).
Create and attach a local swap block device of <swap_size> MB.
size=<size>[,format=<format>] Create and attach a local ephemeral block device of <size> GB and format it to <format>.
Send arbitrary key/value pairs to the scheduler for custom use.

Create a NIC on the server. Specify option multiple times to create multiple NICs. net-id: attach NIC to network with this UUID (required if no port-id), v4 -fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional), port-id: attach NIC to port with this UUID (required if no net-id)
Blocks while server builds so progress can be reported.

section.title: nova cell-capacities command
section.para: Get cell capacities for all cells or a given cell.

listitem.para: Name of the cell to get the capacities.

section.title: nova cell-show command
section.para: Show details of a given cell.

section.title: nova clear-password command
section.para: Clear password for a server.

section.title: nova cloudpipe-configure command
section.para: Update the VPN IP/port of a cloudpipe instance.

section.title: nova cloudpipe-create command
section.para: Create a cloudpipe instance for the given project.

listitem.para: UUID of the project to create the cloudpipe for.

section.title: nova cloudpipe-list command
section.para: Print a list of all cloudpipe instances.

section.title: nova console-log command
section.para: Get console log output of a server.

section.title: nova credentials command
section.para: Show user credentials returned from auth.

listitem.para: wrap PKI tokens to a specified length, or 0 to disable

section.title: nova delete command
section.para: Immediately shut down and delete specified server(s).

section.title: nova diagnostics command
section.para: Retrieve server diagnostics.

section.title: nova dns-create command
section.para: Create a DNS entry for domain, name and ip.

section.title: nova dns-create-private-domain command
section.para: Create the specified DNS domain.

listitem.para: Limit access to this domain to servers in the specified availability zone.

section.title: nova dns-create-public-domain command
section.para: Create the specified DNS domain.

listitem.para: Limit access to this domain to users of the specified project.

section.title: nova dns-delete command
section.para: Delete the specified DNS entry.

section.title: nova dns-delete-domain command
section.para: Delete the specified DNS domain.

section.title: nova dns-domains command
section.para: Print a list of available dns domains.

section.title: nova dns-list command
section.para: List current DNS entries for domain and ip or domain and name.

section.title: nova endpoints command
section.para: Discover endpoints that get returned from the authenticate services.

section.title: nova evacuate command
section.para: Evacuate server from failed host to specified one.

listitem.para: Name or ID of target host.
Set the provided password on the evacuated server. Not applicable with on-shared-storage flag
Specifies whether server files are located on shared storage

section.title: nova fixed-ip-get command
section.para: Retrieve info on a fixed ip.

section.title: nova fixed-ip-reserve command
section.para: Reserve a fixed IP.

section.title: nova fixed-ip-unreserve command
section.para: Unreserve a fixed IP.

section.title: nova flavor-access-add command
section.para: Add flavor access for the given tenant.

listitem.para: Flavor name or ID to add access for the given tenant.
Tenant ID to add flavor access for.

section.title: nova flavor-access-list command
section.para: Print access information about the given flavor.

listitem.para: Filter results by flavor name or ID.

section.title: nova flavor-access-remove command
section.para: Remove flavor access for the given tenant.

listitem.para: Flavor name or ID to remove access for the given tenant.
Tenant ID to remove flavor access for.

section.title: nova flavor-create command
section.para: Create a new flavor

listitem.para: Unique ID (integer or UUID) for the new flavor. If specifying 'auto', a UUID will be generated as id
Make flavor accessible to the public (default true)

section.title: nova flavor-delete command
section.para: Delete a specific flavor

listitem.para: Name or ID of the flavor to delete

section.title: nova flavor-key command
section.para: Set or unset extra_spec for a flavor.

listitem.para: Extra_specs to set/unset (only key is necessary on unset)

section.title: nova flavor-list command
section.para: Print a list of available 'flavors' (sizes of servers).

section.title: nova flavor-show command
section.para: Show details about the given flavor.

section.title: nova floating-ip-associate command
section.para: Associate a floating IP address to a server.

listitem.para: Fixed IP Address to associate with.

section.title: nova floating-ip-bulk-create command
section.para: Bulk create floating ips by range.

section.title: nova floating-ip-bulk-delete command
section.para: Bulk delete floating ips by range.

section.title: nova floating-ip-bulk-list command
section.para: List all floating ips.

section.title: nova floating-ip-create command
section.para: Allocate a floating IP for the current tenant.

section.title: nova floating-ip-delete command
section.para: De-allocate a floating IP.

section.title: nova floating-ip-disassociate command
section.para: Disassociate a floating IP address from a server.

section.title: nova floating-ip-list command
section.para: List floating ips for this tenant.

section.title: nova floating-ip-pool-list command
section.para: List all floating ip pools.

section.title: nova force-delete command
section.para: Force delete a server.

section.title: nova get-password command
section.para: Get password for a server.

listitem.para: Private key (used locally to decrypt password) (Optional). When specified, the command displays the clear (decrypted) VM password. When not specified, the ciphered VM password is displayed.

section.title: nova get-rdp-console command
section.para: Get a rdp console to a server.

section.title: nova get-spice-console command
section.para: Get a spice console to a server.

section.title: nova get-vnc-console command
section.para: Get a vnc console to a server.

section.title: nova host-action command
section.para: Perform a power action on a host.

listitem.para: power action: startup, reboot, or shutdown.

section.title: nova host-describe command
section.para: Describe a specific host.

section.title: nova host-evacuate command
section.para: Evacuate all instances from failed host to specified one.

listitem.para: Specifies whether all instances files are on shared storage

section.title: nova host-list command
section.para: List all hosts by service.

listitem.para: Filters the list, returning only those hosts in the availability zone <zone>.

section.title: nova host-meta command
section.para: Set or Delete metadata on all instances of a host.

listitem.para: Metadata to set or delete (only key is necessary on delete)

section.title: nova host-servers-migrate command
section.para: Migrate all instances of the specified host to other available hosts.

section.title: nova host-update command
section.para: Update host settings.

listitem.para: Either enable or disable a host.
Either put or resume host to/from maintenance.

section.title: nova hypervisor-list command
section.para: List hypervisors.

section.title: nova hypervisor-servers command
section.para: List servers belonging to specific hypervisors.

listitem.para: The hypervisor hostname (or pattern) to search for.

section.title: nova hypervisor-show command
section.para: Display the details of the specified hypervisor.

listitem.para: Name or ID of the hypervisor to show the details of.

section.title: nova hypervisor-stats command
section.para: Get hypervisor statistics over all compute nodes.

section.title: nova hypervisor-uptime command
section.para: Display the uptime of the specified hypervisor.

listitem.para: Name or ID of the hypervisor to show the uptime of.

section.title: nova image-create command
section.para: Create a new image by taking a snapshot of a running server.

listitem.para: Blocks while server snapshots so progress can be reported.

section.title: nova image-delete command
section.para: Delete specified image(s).

section.title: nova image-list command
section.para: Print a list of available images to boot from.

listitem.para: number of images to return per request

section.title: nova image-meta command
section.para: Set or Delete metadata on an image.

listitem.para: Metadata to add/update or delete (only key is necessary on delete)

section.title: nova image-show command
section.para: Show details about the given image.

section.title: nova instance-action command
section.para: Show an action.

listitem.para: Name or UUID of the server to show an action for.
Request ID of the action to get.

section.title: nova instance-action-list command
section.para: List actions on a server.

listitem.para: Name or UUID of the server to list actions for.

section.title: nova interface-attach command
section.para: Attach a network interface to a server.

section.title: nova interface-detach command
section.para: Detach a network interface from a server.

section.title: nova interface-list command
section.para: List interfaces attached to a server.

section.title: nova keypair-add command
section.para: Create a new key pair for use with servers.

listitem.para: Path to a public ssh key.

section.title: nova keypair-delete command
section.para: Delete keypair given by its name.

section.title: nova keypair-list command
section.para: Print a list of keypairs for a user

section.title: nova keypair-show command
section.para: Show details about the given keypair.

section.title: nova list command
section.para: List active servers.

listitem.para: Only return servers that match reservation-id.
Search with regular expression match by IP address (Admin only).
Search with regular expression match by IPv6 address (Admin only).
Search with regular expression match by name
Search with regular expression match by server name (Admin only).
Search by flavor name or ID
Search by image name or ID
Search servers by hostname to which they are assigned (Admin only).
Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Display information from single tenant (Admin only).
Comma-separated list of fields to display. Use the show command to see which fields are available.

section.title: nova list-extensions command
section.para: List all the os-api extensions that are available.

section.title: nova list-secgroup command
section.para: List Security Group(s) of a server.

section.title: nova live-migration command
section.para: Migrate running server to a new machine.

section.title: nova lock command
section.para: Lock a server.

section.title: nova meta command
section.para: Set or Delete metadata on a server.

listitem.para: Metadata to set or delete (only key is necessary on delete)

section.title: nova migrate command
section.para: Migrate a server. The new host will be selected by the scheduler.

listitem.para: Blocks while server migrates so progress can be reported.

section.title: nova migration-list command
section.para: Print a list of migrations.

listitem.para: Fetch migrations for the given host.
Fetch migrations for the given status.
Fetch migrations for the given cell_name.

section.title: nova net command
section.para: Show a network

section.title: nova net-create command
section.para: Create a network

listitem.para: IP block to allocate from (ex. 172.16.0.0/24 or 2001:DB8::/64)

section.title: nova net-delete command
section.para: Delete a network

section.title: nova net-list command
section.para: List networks

section.title: nova network-associate-host command
section.para: Associate host with network.

section.title: nova network-associate-project command
section.para: Associate project with network.

section.title: nova network-create command

screen.computeroutput: usage: nova network-create [--fixed-range-v4 <x.x.x.x/yy>] [--fixed-range-v6 CIDR_V6] [--vlan <vlan id>] [--vpn <vpn start>] [--gateway GATEWAY] [--gateway-v6 GATEWAY_V6] [--bridge <bridge>] [--bridge-interface <bridge interface>] [--multi-host <'T'|'F'>] [--dns1 <DNS Address>] [--dns2 <DNS Address>] [--uuid <network uuid>] [--fixed-cidr <x.x.x.x/yy>] [--project-id <project id>] [--priority <number>] <network_label>

section.para: Create a network.

listitem.para: VIFs on this network are connected to this bridge
the bridge is connected to this interface

section.title: nova network-disassociate command
section.para: Disassociate host and/or project from the given network.

section.title: nova network-list command
section.para: Print a list of available networks.

section.title: nova network-show command
section.para: Show details about the given network.

section.title: nova pause command
section.para: Pause a server.

section.title: nova quota-class-show command
section.para: List the quotas for a quota class.

listitem.para: Name of quota class to list the quotas for.

section.title: nova quota-class-update command
section.para: Update the quotas for a quota class.

listitem.para: Name of quota class to set the quotas for.

section.title: nova quota-defaults command
section.para: List the default quotas for a tenant.

listitem.para: of tenant to list the default quotas for.

section.title: nova quota-delete command
section.para: Delete quota for a tenant/user so their quota will Revert back to default.

listitem.para: of tenant to delete quota for.
of user to delete quota for.

section.title: nova quota-show command
section.para: List the quotas for a tenant/user.

listitem.para: of tenant to list the quotas for.
of user to list the quotas for.

section.title: nova quota-update command
section.para: Update the quotas for a tenant/user.

listitem.para: ID of tenant to set the quotas for.
of user to set the quotas for.
Whether force update the quota even if the already used and reserved exceeds the new quota

section.title: nova rate-limits command
section.para: Print a list of rate limits for a user

section.title: nova reboot command
section.para: Reboot a server.

listitem.para: Perform a hard reboot (instead of a soft one).

section.title: nova rebuild command
section.para: Shutdown, re-image, and re-boot a server.

listitem.para: Name or ID of new image.
Set the provided password on the rebuild server.
Blocks while server rebuilds so progress can be reported.
Skips flavor/image lookups when showing servers
Preserve the default ephemeral storage partition on rebuild.

section.title: nova refresh-network command
section.para: Refresh server network information.

listitem.para: Name or ID of a server for which the network cache should be refreshed from neutron (Admin only).

section.title: nova remove-fixed-ip command
section.para: Remove an IP address from a server.

section.title: nova remove-secgroup command
section.para: Remove a Security Group from a server.

section.title: nova rename command
section.para: Rename a server.

listitem.para: Name (old name) or ID of server.

section.title: nova rescue command
section.para: Rescue a server.

section.title: nova reset-network command
section.para: Reset network of a server.

section.title: nova reset-state command
section.para: Reset the state of a server.

listitem.para: Request the server be reset to "active" state instead of "error" state (the default).

section.title: nova resize command
section.para: Resize a server.

listitem.para: Name or ID of new flavor.
Blocks while servers resizes so progress can be reported.

section.title: nova resize-confirm command
section.para: Confirm a previous resize.

section.title: nova resize-revert command
section.para: Revert a previous resize (and return to the previous VM).

section.title: nova restore command
section.para: Restore a soft-deleted server.

section.title: nova resume command
section.para: Resume a server.

section.title: nova root-password command
section.para: Change the root password for a server.

section.title: nova scrub command
section.para: Delete data associated with the project.

section.title: nova secgroup-add-group-rule command
section.para: Add a source group rule to a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.
ID or name of source group.

section.title: nova secgroup-add-rule command
section.para: Add a rule to a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.

section.title: nova secgroup-create command
section.para: Create a security group.

section.title: nova secgroup-delete command
section.para: Delete a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.

section.title: nova secgroup-delete-group-rule command
section.para: Delete a source group rule from a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.
ID or name of source group.

section.title: nova secgroup-delete-rule command
section.para: Delete a rule from a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.

section.title: nova secgroup-list command
section.para: List security groups for the current tenant.

listitem.para: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).

section.title: nova secgroup-list-rules command
section.para: List rules for a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.

section.title: nova secgroup-update command
section.para: Update a security group.

listitem.para: ID or name of security group.

section.title: nova service-disable command
section.para: Disable the service.

section.title: nova service-enable command
section.para: Enable the service.

section.title: nova service-list command
section.para: Show a list of all running services. Filter by host & binary.

section.title: nova shelve command
section.para: Shelve a server.

section.title: nova shelve-offload command
section.para: Remove a shelved server from the compute node.

section.title: nova show command
section.para: Show details about the given server.

listitem.para: Skips flavor/image lookups when showing servers

section.title: nova ssh command

screen.computeroutput: usage: nova ssh [--port PORT] [--private] [--ipv6] [--login <login>] [-i IDENTITY] [--extra-opts EXTRA] <server>

section.para: SSH into a server.

listitem.para: Optional flag to indicate which port to use for ssh. (Default=22)
Optional flag to indicate whether to only use private address attached to an instance. (Default=False). If no public address is found try private address
Optional flag to indicate whether to use an IPv6 address attached to a server. (Defaults to IPv4 address)
Private key file, same as the -i option to the ssh command.
Extra options to pass to ssh. see: man ssh

section.title: nova start command
section.para: Start a server.

section.title: nova stop command
section.para: Stop a server.

section.title: nova suspend command
section.para: Suspend a server.

section.title: nova unlock command
section.para: Unlock a server.

section.title: nova unpause command
section.para: Unpause a server.

section.title: nova unrescue command
section.para: Unrescue a server.

section.title: nova unshelve command
section.para: Unshelve a server.

section.title: nova usage command
section.para: Show usage data for a single tenant.

listitem.para: Usage range start date ex 2012-01-20 (default: 4 weeks ago)
Usage range end date, ex 2012-01-20 (default: tomorrow)
or name of tenant to get usage for.

section.title: nova usage-list command
section.para: List usage data for all tenants.

listitem.para: Usage range start date ex 2012-01-20 (default: 4 weeks ago)
Usage range end date, ex 2012-01-20 (default: tomorrow)

section.title: nova volume-attach command
section.para: Attach a volume to a server.

listitem.para: ID of the volume to attach.
Name of the device e.g. /dev/vdb. Use "auto" for autoassign (if supported)

section.title: nova volume-create command
section.para: Add a new volume.

listitem.para: Optional snapshot id to create the volume from. (Default=None)
Optional image id to create the volume from. (Default=None)

section.title: nova volume-delete command
section.para: Remove volume(s).

listitem.para: Name or ID of the volume(s) to delete.

section.title: nova volume-detach command
section.para: Detach a volume from a server.

section.title: nova volume-list command
section.para: List all the volumes.

listitem.para: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).

section.title: nova volume-show command
section.para: Show details about a volume.

listitem.para: Name or ID of the volume.

section.title: nova volume-snapshot-create command
section.para: Add a new snapshot.

listitem.para: ID of the volume to snapshot
Optional flag to indicate whether to snapshot a volume even if its attached to a server. (Default=False)

section.title: nova volume-snapshot-delete command
section.para: Remove a snapshot.

listitem.para: Name or ID of the snapshot to delete.

section.title: nova volume-snapshot-list command
section.para: List all the snapshots.

section.title: nova volume-snapshot-show command
section.para: Show details about a snapshot.

listitem.para: Name or ID of the snapshot.

section.title: nova volume-type-create command
section.para: Create a new volume type.

section.title: nova volume-type-delete command
section.para: Delete a specific flavor

listitem.para: Unique ID of the volume type to delete

section.title: nova volume-type-list command
section.para: Print a list of available 'volume types'.

section.title: nova volume-update command
section.para: Update volume attachment.

listitem.para: ID of the volume to attach.

section.title: nova x509-create-cert command
section.para: Create x509 cert for a user in tenant.

listitem.para: Filename for the private key [Default: pk.pem]
Filename for the X.509 certificate [Default: cert.pem]

section.title: nova x509-get-root-cert command
section.para: Fetch the x509 root cert.

listitem.para: Filename to write the x509 root cert.
